job_title: Patient Sitter/Safety Companion in West Plains, MO
pros: Friendly staff, easy job, pays the bills
cons: Dont have good communication, everyone got trained differently

job_title: Discharge Planner in West Plains, MO
pros: Full time benefits with part time hours
cons: Low scale pay compared to other jobs of this nature

job_title: Lab Technician in West Plains, MO
pros: The hours are good and if you need to change hours they will do their best to accommodate change. The training is excellent and they make sure you know what your doing. I cannot say enough good things about the immediate supervisor; wish this person was available when she was actually needed.
cons: If you don't like to gossip about other employee's than you might not fit in. Senior employees think that you have to carry the load and do not pitch in to complete the jobs. They know all the good hiding places or do not return to the lab promptly for more doctors orders for blood draws or duties such as cleaning.

review_title: A hospital where the staff are just that Staff, if you are not and have not been long term employee you do not get heard
job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Plains, MO
pros: It's a job, pay is adequate, but not compensatory for # of hours worked if salaried or for all additional duties and jobs given.
cons: "Career" is not promoted for the small person.  I had a personal great relationship with my direct boss but sometimes still did not get heard enough to make any push for real improvement.  Always felt hands were tied.

job_title: Medical Records Clerk in West Plains, MO
pros: This was one of the very first jobs that I've had in my entire life that I truly enjoyed waking up in the morning and looked forward to getting ready to go to each and every day I was scheduled to work.  When the hospital finally went from paper to electronic, I was very sad indeed to know that I would no longer be an employee there.  I loved my job and all of my coworkers.  I've missed it from the day I left.
cons: I would have liked to have had more professional one on one training while employed there.  A lot of the work I did while employed at Ozarks Medical Center, I ended up, literally, being a self taught employee, but I got through it very well and did my job duties as required and was commended for it on a regular basis.  There were a lot of hard working people dedicated to the confidentiality factors that went along with the medical records department policies and we stood by the rules and ran the department in the most professional manner. I give kudos to all of my coworkers.  They deserve that.

review_title: Pretty good place to work depending on your location
pros: The people and patients are awesome to work with. They are trying to raise pay and increase retention. Ability to make a difference
cons: Not a lot of room for growth. Benefits could be better. Lots of requirements for money and forget patient care at times

pros: Most pretty good to work with. They offer great benefits and retirement.
cons: They changed our menu and upped the prices so unhappy cooks and customers.

pros: Love the Ozarks, the area is beautiful, lots to do if you enjoy the outdoors
cons: Not being heard, not much room to advance but lots of duties added onto staff.
NONE that I can think of.
